poem:
"Freedom Cry, Warsaw's Echo"

Polish sun droops in the mid-afternoon sky,
Duda's cry finds no rest
in the bleak corridors of law and justice.
Abuse of power, years ago, they say--
Kaminski, Wasik are the names.
Iron bars catch their dreams,
a hunger strikes amid the cold--
delivery of conviction, a sour pluck. 
Red is the setting sun,
blue is Warsaw's soul.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Polish president says he will work to free conservative politicians as former minister launches hunger strike – as it happened 2.58pm GMT Summary of the day Polish president Andrzej Duda said that he would not rest until Law and Justice politicians Mariusz Kamiński and Maciej Wąsik are freed from prison. The two were convicted of abuse of power for actions taken in 2007, and a court on Monday issued orders for police to deliver them". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Polish president says he will work to free conservative politicians as former minister launches hunger strike – as it happened 2.58pm GMT Summary of the day Polish president Andrzej Duda said that he would not rest until Law and Justice politicians Mariusz Kamiński and Maciej Wąsik are freed from prison. The two were convicted of abuse of power for actions taken in 2007, and a court on Monday issued orders for police to deliver them
